  Infrastructure Levy

Section  137

##### Infrastructure Levy: England

1

After Part 10 of the Planning Act 2008 insert—

######### Infrastructure Levy: England

########## The levy

1.204A

1.204A.1

The Secretary of State may with the consent of the Treasury make regulations
providing for the imposition, in England, of a charge to be known as
Infrastructure Levy (IL).

1.204A.2

In making the regulations, the Secretary of State must aim to ensure that the
overall purpose of IL is to ensure that costs incurred in—

1.204A.2.a

supporting the development of an area, and

1.204A.2.b

achieving any purpose specified under section 204N(5), 204O(3) or 204P(3),

can be funded (wholly or partly) by owners or developers of land in a way that
does not make development of the area economically unviable.

1.204A.3

The Table describes the provisions of this Part.

    Section Topic   Section  204B The charge Section  204C Joint committees
Sections  204D  and  204E Liability Section  204F Charities Section  204G
Amount Sections  204H  to  204M Charging schedule Sections  204N  to  204P
Application Section  204Q Infrastructure delivery strategy Section  204R
Collection Section  204S Enforcement Section  204T Compensation Section  204U
Procedure Section  204V Appeals Sections  204W  to  204Y Secretary of State:
powers Section  204Z1 IL regulations: general Section  204Z2 Relationship with
other powers

1.204A.4

In this Part—

      “ affordable housing ” means—         social housing within the meaning
of Part 2 of the Housing and Regeneration Act 2008, and           any other
description of housing that IL regulations may specify;                 “ IL ”
has the meaning given in  subsection (1) ;           “ IL regulations ” means
regulations under this section.

########## The charge

1.204B

1.204B.1

A charging authority in England must, in accordance with IL regulations,
charge IL in respect of development in its area.

1.204B.2

A local planning authority is the charging authority for its area.

1.204B.3

But—

1.204B.3.a

the Council of the Isles of Scilly is the only charging authority for the
Isles of Scilly, and

1.204B.3.b

the Homes and Communities Agency is the charging authority for an area only to
the extent provided in a designation order made under section 13 of the
Housing and Regeneration Act 2008.

1.204B.4

IL regulations may provide for any of the following to be the charging
authority for an area in England in place of the charging authority under
subsection  (2)  or  (3) (a) —

1.204B.4.a

a county council in England,

1.204B.4.b

a district council,

1.204B.4.c

a metropolitan district council, and

1.204B.4.d

a London borough council (within the meaning of TCPA 1990).

1.204B.5

In this section, “local planning authority” has the meaning given by section
15LH  of PCPA 2004, except that a development corporation is a local planning
authority for the purposes of this section only if it is the local planning
authority for the whole of its area for all purposes of Part 2 of PCPA 2004.

1.204B.6

IL regulations may make transitional provision in connection with, or in
anticipation of, any person or body—

1.204B.6.a

becoming a charging authority, or

1.204B.6.b

ceasing to be a charging authority.

########## Joint committees

1.204C

1.204C.1

This section applies if a joint committee that includes a charging authority
is established under section  15J  of PCPA 2004.

1.204C.2

IL regulations may provide that the joint committee is to exercise specified
functions, in respect of the area specified in the agreement under section
15J (1)  of PCPA 2004, on behalf of the charging authority.

1.204C.3

The regulations may make provision corresponding to provisions relating to
joint committees in Part 6 of the Local Government Act 1972 in respect of the
discharge of the specified functions.

########## Liability

1.204D

1.204D.1

Where liability to IL would arise in respect of proposed development (in
accordance with provision made by a charging authority under and by virtue of
section 204B  and IL regulations) a person may assume liability to pay the
levy.

1.204D.2

An assumption of liability—

1.204D.2.a

may be made before development commences, and

1.204D.2.b

must be made in accordance with any provision of IL regulations about the
procedure for assuming liability.

1.204D.3

A person who assumes liability for IL before the commencement of development
becomes liable when development is commenced in reliance on planning
permission.

1.204D.4

IL regulations must make provision for an owner or developer of land or
another specified person to be liable for IL where development is commenced in
reliance on planning permission if—

1.204D.4.a

nobody assumes liability in accordance with the regulations, or

1.204D.4.b

other specified circumstances arise (such as the insolvency or withdrawal of a
person who has assumed liability).

1.204D.5

IL regulations may make provision about—

1.204D.5.a

joint liability (with or without several liability);

1.204D.5.b

liability of partnerships;

1.204D.5.c

assumption of partial liability (and subsection  (4) (a)  applies where
liability has not been wholly assumed);

1.204D.5.d

apportionment of liability (which may include provision for referral to a
specified person or body for determination);

1.204D.5.e

withdrawal of assumption of liability;

1.204D.5.f

cancellation of assumption of liability by a charging authority (in which case
subsection  (4) (a)  applies);

1.204D.5.g

transfer of liability (whether before or after development commences and
whether or not liability has been assumed);

1.204D.5.h

exemption from, or reduction in, liability.

1.204D.6

The amount of any liability for IL is to be calculated by reference to the
charging schedule which has effect at the time when planning permission first
permits the development as a result of which the levy becomes payable.

1.204D.7

IL regulations may make provision for liability for IL to arise where
development which requires planning permission is commenced without it (and
subsection  (6)  is subject to this subsection).

1.204D.8

IL regulations may provide for liability to IL to arise in respect of a
development where—

1.204D.8.a

the development was exempt from IL, or subject to a reduced rate of IL, and

1.204D.8.b

the description or purpose of the development changes.

########## Liability: interpretation of key terms

1.204E

1.204E.1

In section  204D  “development”  means—

1.204E.1.a

anything done by way of or for the purpose of the creation of a new building,

1.204E.1.b

anything done to or in respect of an existing building, or

1.204E.1.c

any change in the use of an existing building or part of a building.

1.204E.2

IL regulations may provide for—

1.204E.2.a

works, or changes in use, of a specified kind not to be treated as
development;

1.204E.2.b

the creation of, or anything done to or in respect of, a structure of a
specified kind to be treated as development.

1.204E.3

IL regulations must include provision for determining when development is
treated as commencing.

1.204E.4

Regulations under subsection  (3)  may, in particular, provide for development
to be treated as commencing when some specified activity or event is
undertaken or occurs, where the activity or event—

1.204E.4.a

is not development within the meaning of subsection  (1) , but

1.204E.4.b

has a specified kind of connection with a development within the meaning of
that subsection.

1.204E.5

IL regulations must define planning permission (which may include planning
permission within the meaning of TCPA 1990 and any other kind of permission or
consent (however called, and whether general or specific)).

1.204E.6

IL regulations must include provision for determining the time at which
planning permission is treated as first permitting development; and the
regulations may, in particular, make provision—

1.204E.6.a

about outline planning permission;

1.204E.6.b

for permission to be treated as having been given at a particular time in the
case of general consents.

1.204E.7

For the purposes of section  204D —

1.204E.7.a

“owner” of land means a person who owns an interest in the land, and

1.204E.7.b

“developer” means a person who is wholly or partly responsible for carrying
out a development.

1.204E.8

IL regulations may make provision for a person to be or not to be treated as
an owner or developer of land in specified circumstances.

########## Charities

1.204F

1.204F.1

IL regulations must provide for an exemption from liability to pay IL in
respect of a development where—

1.204F.1.a

the person who would otherwise be liable to pay IL in respect of the
development is a relevant charity in England and Wales, and

1.204F.1.b

the building or structure in respect of which IL liability would otherwise
arise is to be used wholly or mainly for a charitable purpose of the charity
within the meaning of section 2 of the Charities Act 2011.

1.204F.2

IL regulations may—

1.204F.2.a

provide for an exemption from liability to pay IL where the person who would
otherwise be liable to pay IL in respect of the development is an institution
established for a charitable purpose;

1.204F.2.b

require charging authorities to make arrangements for an exemption from, or
reduction in, liability to pay IL where the person who would otherwise be
liable to pay IL in respect of the development is an institution established
for a charitable purpose.

1.204F.3

Regulations under subsection  (1)  or  (2)  may provide that an exemption or
reduction does not apply if specified conditions are satisfied.

1.204F.4

For the purposes of subsection  (1) , a relevant charity in England and Wales
is an institution which—

1.204F.4.a

is registered in the register of charities kept by the Charity Commission
under section 29 of the Charities Act 2011, or

1.204F.4.b

is a charity within the meaning of section 1(1) of the Charities Act 2011 but
is not required to be registered in the register kept under section 29 of that
Act.

1.204F.5

In subsection  (2) , a charitable purpose is a purpose falling within section
3(1) of the Charities Act 2011; but IL regulations may provide for an
institution of a specified kind to be, or not to be, treated as an institution
established for a charitable purpose.

########## Amount

1.204G

1.204G.1

A charging authority must, in accordance with IL regulations, issue a document
(a “charging schedule”) setting rates, or other criteria, by reference to
which the amount of IL chargeable in respect of development in its area is to
be determined.

1.204G.2

A charging authority, in setting rates or other criteria, must, to the extent
and in the manner specified by IL regulations, seek to ensure that—

1.204G.2.a

the level of affordable housing which is funded by developers and provided in
the authority’s area, and

1.204G.2.b

the level of funding provided by developers of affordable housing provided in
the authority’s area,

can be maintained at a level which, over a specified period, is equal to or
exceeds the level of such housing and funding provided over an earlier
specified period of the same length.

1.204G.3

Subsection  (2)  does not apply if the charging authority considers that
complying with it would make development of the authority’s area economically
unviable.

1.204G.4

The references in subsection  (2)  to the funding of affordable housing by
developers are to its funding by developers through IL or by any other means.

1.204G.5

For the purposes of subsection  (2) , IL regulations may make provision about—

1.204G.5.a

how the level of affordable housing provided in the area is to be measured,
and

1.204G.5.b

how the level of funding provided by developers is to be measured.

1.204G.6

A charging authority, in setting rates or other criteria, must have regard, to
the extent and in the manner specified by IL regulations, to—

1.204G.6.a

matters specified by IL regulations relating to the economic viability of
development (which may include, in particular, actual or potential economic
effects of the imposition of IL);

1.204G.6.b

matters specified by IL regulations relating to the actual or potential
economic effects (including increases in the value of land) of—

1.204G.6.b.i

a development plan (construed in accordance with section 38 of PCPA 2004),

1.204G.6.b.ii

planning permission,

1.204G.6.b.iii

the provision of infrastructure, or

1.204G.6.b.iv

any other matter that may affect the value of land;

1.204G.6.c

the amount of IL, and anything else specified in IL regulations, provided in
connection with development in the authority’s area over such period as may be
specified in IL regulations;

1.204G.6.d

its infrastructure delivery strategy (see section  204Q ).

1.204G.7

IL regulations may make other provision about setting rates or other criteria.

1.204G.8

The regulations may, in particular, permit or require charging authorities in
setting rates or other criteria—

1.204G.8.a

to have regard, to the extent and in the manner specified by the regulations,
to actual or expected administrative expenses in connection with IL;

1.204G.8.b

to have regard, to the extent and in the manner specified by the regulations,
to actual and expected costs of anything other than infrastructure that is
concerned with addressing demands that development places on an area (whether
by reference to lists prepared by virtue of section  204N (7) (a)  or
otherwise);

1.204G.8.c

to have regard, to the extent and in the manner specified by the regulations,
to other actual and expected sources of funding for anything other than
infrastructure that is concerned with addressing demands that development
places on an area;

1.204G.8.d

to have regard, to the extent and in the manner specified by the regulations,
to values used or documents produced for other statutory purposes;

1.204G.8.e

to integrate the process, to the extent and in the manner specified by the
regulations, with processes undertaken for other statutory purposes;

1.204G.8.f

to provide for rates or other criteria to change over time or on the
occurrence of specified events (and, for these purposes, the regulations may
make provision about how and when they are to change);

1.204G.8.g

to produce charging schedules having effect in relation to specified periods
(subject to revision).

1.204G.9

The regulations may permit or require charging schedules to adopt specified
methods of calculation.

1.204G.10

In particular, the regulations may—

1.204G.10.a

permit or require charging schedules to operate by reference to descriptions
or purposes of development;

1.204G.10.b

permit or require charging schedules to operate by reference to any
measurement of the amount or nature of development (whether by reference to
measurements of floor space, to numbers or intended uses of buildings, to
numbers or intended uses of units within buildings, to allocation of space
within buildings or units, to values or expected values or in any other way);

1.204G.10.c

permit or require charging schedules to operate by reference to the nature or
existing use of the place where development is undertaken;

1.204G.10.d

permit or require charging schedules to operate by reference to an index used
for determining a rate of inflation;

1.204G.10.e

permit or require charging schedules to operate by reference to values used or
documents produced for other statutory purposes;

1.204G.10.f

provide, or permit or require provision, for differential rates, which may
include provision for supplementary charges, a nil rate, increased rates or
reductions;

1.204G.10.g

permit or require any threshold below which IL is charged at a nil rate or a
reduced rate to be determined in a specified way, including for it to be
increased or decreased by reference to the costs of development in a charging
authority’s area (and, for these purposes, the regulations may require the
charging authority to publish information relating to the costs of development
in its area).

1.204G.11

The regulations may require a charging authority to provide estimates in
connection with the IL chargeable in respect of development (including
estimates of the amount of IL that is chargeable and estimates in connection
with any payments in a form other than money permitted or required under
section 204R(4)).

1.204G.12

A charging authority may revise or replace a charging schedule.

1.204G.13

Subsections  (2)  to  (10)  and sections  204H  to  204L  apply in relation to
a revision or replacement of a charging schedule as they apply in relation to
a charging schedule.

########## Charging schedule: consultation and evidence

1.204H

1.204H.1

A charging authority may consult, or take other steps, in connection with the
preparation of a charging schedule (subject to IL regulations).

1.204H.2

A charging authority must use appropriate available evidence to inform the
charging authority’s preparation of a charging schedule.

1.204H.3

IL regulations may make provision about the application of subsection  (2)
including, in particular—

1.204H.3.a

provision as to evidence that is to be taken to be appropriate,

1.204H.3.b

provision as to evidence that is to be taken to be not appropriate,

1.204H.3.c

provision as to evidence that is to be taken to be available,

1.204H.3.d

provision as to evidence that is to be taken to be not available,

1.204H.3.e

provision as to how evidence is, and as to how evidence is not, to be used,

1.204H.3.f

provision as to evidence that is, and as to evidence that is not, to be used,

1.204H.3.g

provision as to evidence that may, and as to evidence that need not, be used,
and

1.204H.3.h

provision as to how the use of evidence is to inform the preparation of a
charging schedule.

########## Charging schedule: examination

1.204I

1.204I.1

Before approving a charging schedule a charging authority must appoint a
person (“the examiner”) to examine a draft.

1.204I.2

The charging authority must appoint someone who, in the opinion of the
authority—

1.204I.2.a

is independent of the charging authority, and

1.204I.2.b

has appropriate qualifications and experience.

1.204I.3

The charging authority may, with the agreement of the examiner, appoint
persons to assist the examiner.

1.204I.4

In this section and section  204J , “the drafting requirements”  means the
requirements of this Part and IL regulations (including the requirements to
have regard to the matters listed in  section 204G (2) ,  (6)  and  (8) ), so
far as relevant to the drafting of the schedule.

1.204I.5

The examiner must consider whether the drafting requirements have been
complied with and—

1.204I.5.a

make recommendations in accordance with section  204J , and

1.204I.5.b

give reasons for the recommendations.

1.204I.6

The charging authority must publish the recommendations and reasons.

1.204I.7

IL regulations must require a charging authority to allow anyone who makes
representations about a draft charging schedule to be heard by the examiner;
and the regulations may make provision about timing and procedure.

1.204I.8

IL regulations may make provision for examiners to reconsider their decisions
with a view to correcting errors (before or after the approval of a charging
schedule).

1.204I.9

The charging authority may withdraw a draft charging schedule.

########## Charging schedule: examiner’s recommendations

1.204J

1.204J.1

This section applies in relation to the examination, under section  204I , of
a draft charging schedule.

1.204J.2

If the examiner considers—

1.204J.2.a

that there is any respect in which the drafting requirements have not been
complied with, and

1.204J.2.b

that the non-compliance with the drafting requirements cannot be remedied by
the making of modifications to the draft,

the examiner must recommend that the draft be rejected.

1.204J.3

Subsection  (4)  applies if the examiner considers—

1.204J.3.a

that there is any respect in which the drafting requirements have not been
complied with, and

1.204J.3.b

that the non-compliance with the drafting requirements could be remedied by
the making of modifications to the draft.

1.204J.4

The examiner must—

1.204J.4.a

specify the respects in which the drafting requirements have not been complied
with,

1.204J.4.b

recommend modifications that the examiner considers sufficient and necessary
to remedy that non-compliance, and

1.204J.4.c

recommend that the draft be approved with—

1.204J.4.c.i

those modifications, or

1.204J.4.c.ii

other modifications sufficient and necessary to remedy that non-compliance.

1.204J.5

Subject to subsections  (2)  to  (4) , the examiner must recommend that the
draft be approved.

1.204J.6

If the examiner makes recommendations under subsection  (4) , the examiner may
recommend other modifications with which the draft should be approved in the
event that it is approved.

1.204J.7

If the examiner makes recommendations under subsection  (5) , the examiner may
recommend modifications with which the draft should be approved in the event
that it is approved.

########## Charging schedule: approval

1.204K

1.204K.1

A charging authority may approve a charging schedule only if—

1.204K.1.a

the examiner makes recommendations under section  204J (4)  or  (5) , and

1.204K.1.b

the charging authority has had regard to those recommendations and the
examiner’s reasons for them.

1.204K.2

Accordingly, a charging authority may not approve a charging schedule if,
under section  204J (2) , the examiner recommends rejection.

1.204K.3

If the examiner makes recommendations under section  204J (4) , the charging
authority may approve the charging schedule only if it does so with
modifications that are sufficient and necessary to remedy the non-compliance
specified under section  204J (4) (a)  (although those modifications need not
be the ones recommended under section  204J (4) (b) ).

1.204K.4

If a charging authority approves a charging schedule, it may do so with all or
none, or some one or more, of the modifications (if any) recommended under
section  204J (6)  or  (7) .

1.204K.5

The modifications with which a charging schedule may be approved include only—

1.204K.5.a

modifications required by subsection  (3) , and

1.204K.5.b

modifications allowed by subsection  (4) .

1.204K.6

A charging authority must approve a charging schedule—

1.204K.6.a

at a meeting of the authority, and

1.204K.6.b

by a majority of votes of members present.

1.204K.7

Subsection  (8)  applies if—

1.204K.7.a

the examiner makes recommendations under section  204J (4) , and

1.204K.7.b

the charging schedule is approved by the charging authority.

1.204K.8

The charging authority must publish a report setting out how the charging
schedule as approved remedies the non-compliance specified under section  204J
(4) (a) .

1.204K.9

IL regulations may make provision about the form or contents of a report under
subsection  (8) .

1.204K.10

IL regulations may make provision for the correction of errors in a charging
schedule after approval.

1.204K.11

In this section “examiner”  means the examiner under section  204I .

########## Charging schedule: application and effect

1.204L

1.204L.1

A charging schedule approved under section  204K  may not take effect before
the charging authority issues the schedule (by publishing it).

1.204L.2

IL regulations may, subject to subsection  (1) , make provision about when a
charging schedule may, must or may not take effect.

1.204L.3

IL regulations may make provision about publication of a charging schedule
after approval.

1.204L.4

The provision that may be made under subsection  (3)  includes provision about
information or documents that must be published alongside the charging
schedule.

########## Charging schedule: due date

1.204M

1.204M.1

IL regulations may make provision as to when a charging authority must issue a
charging schedule.

1.204M.2

But the regulations may not require a charging authority to issue a charging
schedule before the end of the period of 12 months beginning with the day on
which the Secretary of State publishes, or provides to the authority, written
notice that it will be required to issue a charging schedule.

1.204M.3

If a charging authority does not issue its charging schedule in accordance
with provision made under subsection  (1) , the Secretary of State may appoint
a person to prepare and issue it on behalf of the charging authority.

1.204M.4

IL regulations may make provision about—

1.204M.4.a

procedures for appointing a person under subsection  (3) ,

1.204M.4.b

conditions which must be met before such an appointment may be made,

1.204M.4.c

procedures which must be followed by the person in preparing and issuing the
charging schedule,

1.204M.4.d

the appointment of assistants for the person,

1.204M.4.e

circumstances in which the person may be replaced,

1.204M.4.f

duties of a charging authority where a person is appointed to act on its
behalf under subsection  (3) , and

1.204M.4.g

liability for costs incurred as a result of the appointment of the person.

########## Application

1.204N

1.204N.1

Subject to this section and sections  204O (1)  to  (3) ,  204P (2)  and  (3)
, and  204T (5) , IL regulations must require the authority that charges IL to
apply it, or cause it to be applied, to supporting the development of an area
by funding the provision, improvement, replacement, operation or maintenance
of infrastructure.

1.204N.2

IL regulations may make provision about the extent to which the IL paid to a
charging authority may or must be applied to funding the provision,
improvement, replacement, operation or maintenance of infrastructure of a
particular description.

1.204N.3

In this section (except  subsection (4) ) and sections  204G ,  204O (2) ,
204P (2) ,  204Q  and  204Z  “infrastructure”  includes—

1.204N.3.a

roads and other transport facilities,

1.204N.3.b

flood defences,

1.204N.3.c

schools and other educational facilities,

1.204N.3.d

medical facilities,

1.204N.3.e

sporting and recreational facilities,

1.204N.3.f

open spaces, 

1.204N.3.g

affordable housing,

1.204N.3.h

facilities and equipment for emergency and rescue services,

1.204N.3.i

facilities and spaces which—

1.204N.3.i.i

preserve or improve the natural environment, or

1.204N.3.i.ii

enable or facilitate enjoyment of the natural environment, and

1.204N.3.j

facilities and spaces for the mitigation of, and adaptation to, climate
change.

1.204N.4

The regulations may amend this section so as to—

1.204N.4.a

add, remove or vary an entry in the list of matters included within the
meaning of “infrastructure”;

1.204N.4.b

list matters excluded from the meaning of “infrastructure”.

1.204N.5

The regulations may make provision about circumstances in which authorities
may apply a specified amount of IL, or cause a specified amount of IL to be
applied, towards specified purposes which are not mentioned in subsection  (1)
.

1.204N.6

The regulations may specify—

1.204N.6.a

works, installations and other facilities whose provision, improvement or
replacement may or is to be, or may not be, funded by IL,

1.204N.6.b

maintenance activities and operational activities (including operational
activities of a promotional kind) in connection with infrastructure that may
or are to be, or may not be, funded by IL,

1.204N.6.c

things within section  204O (2) (b)  that may or are to be, or may not be,
funded by IL passed to a person in discharge of a duty under section  204O (1)
,

1.204N.6.d

things within section  204P (2) (b)  that may or are to be, or may not be,
funded by IL to which provision under section  204P (2)  relates,

1.204N.6.e

criteria for determining the areas that may benefit from funding by IL, and

1.204N.6.f

what is to be, or not to be, treated as funding.

1.204N.7

The regulations may—

1.204N.7.a

require charging authorities to prepare and publish a list of what is to be,
or may be, wholly or partly funded by IL;

1.204N.7.b

include provision about the procedure to be followed in preparing a list
(which may include provision for consultation or for the appointment of an
independent person or both);

1.204N.7.c

include provision about the circumstances in which a charging authority may
and may not apply IL to anything not included on the list;

1.204N.7.d

permit or require the list to be prepared and published as part of an
infrastructure delivery strategy (see section  204Q ).

1.204N.8

In making provision about funding the regulations may, in particular—

1.204N.8.a

permit IL to be used to reimburse expenditure already incurred;

1.204N.8.b

permit IL to be reserved for expenditure that may be incurred in the future;

1.204N.8.c

permit IL to be applied (either generally or subject to limits set by or
determined in accordance with the regulations) to administrative expenses in
connection with infrastructure or anything within section  204O (2) (b)  or
204P (2) (b)  or in connection with IL;

1.204N.8.d

include provision for the giving of loans, guarantees or indemnities;

1.204N.8.e

make provision about the application of IL where anything to which it was to
be applied no longer requires funding.

1.204N.9

The regulations may—

1.204N.9.a

require a charging authority to account separately, and in accordance with the
regulations, for IL received or due;

1.204N.9.b

require a charging authority to monitor the use made and to be made of IL in
its area;

1.204N.9.c

require a charging authority to report on actual or expected charging,
collection and application of IL;

1.204N.9.d

permit a charging authority to cause money to be applied in respect of things
done outside its area;

1.204N.9.e

permit a charging authority or other body (including a collecting authority
under section  204R (7) ) to spend or retain money;

1.204N.9.f

permit a charging authority to pass money to another body (and in paragraphs
(a) to (e) a reference to a charging authority includes a reference to a body
to which a charging authority passes money in reliance on this paragraph).

########## Duty to pass receipts to other persons

1.204O

1.204O.1

IL regulations may require that IL received in respect of development in an
area is to be passed by the charging authority that charged the IL to a person
other than that authority.

1.204O.2

IL regulations must contain provision to secure that money passed to a person
in discharge of a duty under subsection  (1)  is used to support the
development of the area to which the duty relates, or of any part of that
area, by funding—

1.204O.2.a

the provision, improvement, replacement, operation or maintenance of
infrastructure, or

1.204O.2.b

anything else that is concerned with addressing demands that development
places on an area.

1.204O.3

The regulations may make provision about circumstances in which a specified
amount of the money may be used for specified purposes which are not mentioned
in subsection  (2) .

1.204O.4

A duty under subsection  (1)  may relate to—

1.204O.4.a

the whole of a charging authority’s area or the whole of the combined area of
two or more charging authorities, or

1.204O.4.b

part only of such an area or combined area.

1.204O.5

IL regulations may make provision about the persons to whom IL may or must, or
may not, be passed in discharge of a duty under subsection  (1) .

1.204O.6

A duty under subsection  (1)  may relate—

1.204O.6.a

to all IL (if any) received in respect of the area to which the duty relates,
or

1.204O.6.b

such part of that IL as is specified in, or determined under or in accordance
with, IL regulations.

1.204O.7

IL regulations may make provision in connection with the timing of payments in
discharge of a duty under subsection  (1) .

1.204O.8

IL regulations may, in relation to IL passed to a person in discharge of a
duty under subsection  (1) , make provision about—

1.204O.8.a

accounting for the IL,

1.204O.8.b

monitoring its use,

1.204O.8.c

reporting on its use,

1.204O.8.d

responsibilities of charging authorities for things done by the person in
connection with the IL,

1.204O.8.e

recovery of the IL, and any income or profits accruing in respect of it or
from its application, in cases where—

1.204O.8.e.i

anything to be funded by it has not been provided, or

1.204O.8.e.ii

it has been misapplied,

including recovery of sums or other assets representing it or any such income
or profits, and

1.204O.8.f

use of anything recovered in cases where—

1.204O.8.f.i

anything to be funded by the IL has not been provided, or

1.204O.8.f.ii

the IL has been misapplied.

1.204O.9

This section does not limit section  204N (9) (f) .

########## Use of IL in an area to which section 

1.204P

1.204P.1

Subsection (2) applies where—

1.204P.1.a

there is an area to which a particular duty under section  204O (1)  relates,
and

1.204P.1.b

there is also an area to which that duty does not relate (“the uncovered
area”).

1.204P.2

IL regulations may provide that the charging authority that charges IL
received in respect of development in the uncovered area may apply the IL, or
cause it to be applied, to—

1.204P.2.a

support development by funding the provision, improvement, replacement,
operation or maintenance of infrastructure, or

1.204P.2.b

support development of the uncovered area, or of any part of that area, by
funding anything else that is concerned with addressing demands that
development places on an area.

1.204P.3

The regulations may make provision about circumstances in which the authority
may apply a specified amount of IL, or cause a specified amount of IL to be
applied, towards specified purposes which are not mentioned in subsection  (2)
.

1.204P.4

Provision under subsection  (2)  may relate to the whole, or part only, of the
uncovered area.

1.204P.5

Provision under subsection  (2)  may relate—

1.204P.5.a

to all IL (if any) received in respect of the area to which the provision
relates, or

1.204P.5.b

such part of that IL as is specified in, or determined under or in accordance
with, IL regulations.

########## Infrastructure delivery strategy

1.204Q

1.204Q.1

A charging authority must prepare and publish an infrastructure delivery
strategy for its area.

1.204Q.2

The infrastructure delivery strategy must—

1.204Q.2.a

set out the strategic plans (however expressed) of the charging authority in
relation to the application of IL, and

1.204Q.2.b

include such other information as may be prescribed by IL regulations.

1.204Q.3

The infrastructure delivery strategy may and, if required by IL regulations,
must set out the plans (however expressed) of the charging authority in
relation to the provision, improvement, replacement, operation and maintenance
of infrastructure in the authority’s area.

1.204Q.4

The charging authority may at any time prepare and publish a revision to, or
replacement of, its infrastructure delivery strategy.

1.204Q.5

The charging authority must prepare and publish a revision to, or replacement
of, its infrastructure delivery strategy if it is necessary or expedient in
consequence of the publication, revision or replacement of a charging schedule
in relation to the charging authority’s area.

1.204Q.6

IL regulations must make provision for the independent examination of—

1.204Q.6.a

infrastructure delivery strategies, and

1.204Q.6.b

revisions to, or replacements of, such strategies.

1.204Q.7

The regulations must make provision for the examination to be combined with—

1.204Q.7.a

an examination under this Part in relation to a charging schedule, or

1.204Q.7.b

an examination under Part 2 of PCPA 2004 in relation to a local plan.

1.204Q.8

The regulations may, in particular, make provision—

1.204Q.8.a

about who is to carry out the examination;

1.204Q.8.b

about what the examiner must, may or may not consider;

1.204Q.8.c

about the procedure to be followed;

1.204Q.8.d

about recommendations, or other consequences, arising from or in connection
with the examination;

1.204Q.8.e

about circumstances in which an examination is not required;

1.204Q.8.f

applying, or corresponding to, any provision made by or under this Part
relating to an examination in relation to a charging schedule (with or without
modifications).

1.204Q.9

The charging authority must have regard to any guidance published by the
Secretary of State in relation to the preparation, publication, revision or
replacement of infrastructure delivery strategies.

1.204Q.10

IL regulations may provide that a public authority other than the charging
authority is to exercise a function under this section in place of, or on
behalf of, the charging authority.

1.204Q.11

IL regulations must make provision about—

1.204Q.11.a

the form and content of infrastructure delivery strategies;

1.204Q.11.b

the publication of infrastructure delivery strategies and any related
documents;

1.204Q.11.c

the procedures to be followed in relation to the preparation, revision or
replacement of infrastructure delivery strategies;

1.204Q.11.d

consultation in connection with infrastructure delivery strategies.

1.204Q.12

IL regulations may make provision about—

1.204Q.12.a

the timing of any steps in connection with the preparation, publication,
revision or replacement of infrastructure delivery strategies;

1.204Q.12.b

the evidence required to inform the preparation of infrastructure delivery
strategies;

1.204Q.12.c

the preparation of joint infrastructure delivery strategies;

1.204Q.12.d

the period of time for which infrastructure delivery strategies are valid.

########## Collection

1.204R

1.204R.1

IL regulations must include provision about the collection of IL.

1.204R.2

The regulations may make provision for payment—

1.204R.2.a

on account;

1.204R.2.b

by instalments.

1.204R.3

The regulations may make provision about repayment (with or without interest)
in cases of overpayment.

1.204R.4

The regulations may make provision about payment in forms other than money
(such as providing, improving, replacing, operating or maintaining
infrastructure, making land available, carrying out works or providing
services), including about what provision may or must be made by a charging
authority in its charging schedule or elsewhere if payment in a form other
than money is to be permitted or required.

1.204R.5

So long as affordable housing falls within the meaning of “infrastructure”
given by  section 204N (3) , regulations under subsection  (4)  must permit
charging authorities, in the circumstances and to the extent specified in the
regulations, to require IL to be paid by providing affordable housing on the
development site.

1.204R.6

In subsection  (5)  “ development site ” means the site on which the
development in respect of which the IL is charged takes place.

1.204R.7

The regulations may permit or require a charging authority or other public
authority to collect IL charged by another authority; and section  204N (9)
(a)  and  (c)  apply to a collecting authority in respect of collection as to
a charging authority.

1.204R.8

Regulations under this section may make provision corresponding to or applying
(with or without modifications) any enactment relating to the collection of a
tax.

1.204R.9

Regulations under this section may make provision about the source of payments
in respect of Crown interests.

########## Enforcement

1.204S

1.204S.1

IL regulations must include provision about enforcement of IL.

1.204S.2

The regulations must make provision about the consequences of failure to
assume liability, late payment and failure to pay.

1.204S.3

The regulations may make provision about the consequences of failure to give a
notice or to comply with another procedure under IL regulations in connection
with IL.

1.204S.4

The regulations may, in particular, include provision—

1.204S.4.a

for the payment of interest;

1.204S.4.b

for the imposition of a penalty or surcharge;

1.204S.4.c

for the suspension or cancellation of a decision relating to planning
permission;

1.204S.4.d

enabling an authority to prohibit development pending assumption of liability
for IL or pending payment of IL;

1.204S.4.e

conferring a power of entry onto land;

1.204S.4.f

creating a criminal offence (including, in particular, offences relating to
evasion or attempted evasion or to the provision of false or misleading
information or failure to provide information, and offences relating to the
prevention or investigation of other offences created by the regulations);

1.204S.4.g

conferring power to prosecute an offence;

1.204S.4.h

for enforcement of sums owed (whether by action on a debt, by distraint
against goods or in any other way);

1.204S.4.i

conferring jurisdiction on a court to grant injunctive or other relief to
enforce a provision of the regulations (including a provision included in
reliance on this section);

1.204S.4.j

for enforcement in the case of death or insolvency of a person liable for IL.

1.204S.5

IL regulations may include provision (whether or not in the context of late
payment or failure to pay) about registration or notification of actual or
potential liability to IL.

1.204S.6

IL regulations may make provision for the prohibition or restriction of the
use or occupation of all or part of the site of, or anything created in the
course of, a development pending payment of IL in respect of the development.

1.204S.7

IL regulations may include provision—

1.204S.7.a

for the creation of local land charges;

1.204S.7.b

for the registration of local land charges;

1.204S.7.c

for enforcement of local land charges (including, in particular, for
enforcement—

1.204S.7.c.i

against successive owners, and

1.204S.7.c.ii

by way of sale or other disposal with consent of a court);

1.204S.7.d

for making entries in statutory registers;

1.204S.7.e

for the cancellation of charges and entries.

1.204S.8

Regulations under this section may make provision corresponding to or applying
(with or without modifications) any enactment relating to the enforcement of a
tax.

1.204S.9

Regulations under this section may provide that any interest, penalty or
surcharge payable by virtue of the regulations is to be treated for the
purposes of sections  204N  to  204U  as if it were IL.

1.204S.10

The regulations providing for a surcharge or penalty must ensure that no
surcharge or penalty in respect of an amount of IL exceeds the higher of—

1.204S.10.a

40% of that amount, and

1.204S.10.b

£50,000.

1.204S.11

But the regulations may provide for more than one surcharge or penalty to be
imposed in relation to an IL charge.

1.204S.12

The regulations may not authorise entry to a private dwelling without a
warrant issued by a justice of the peace.

1.204S.13

Regulations under this section creating a criminal offence may not provide
for—

1.204S.13.a

imprisonment for a term exceeding the maximum term for summary offences, on
summary conviction for an offence triable summarily only,

1.204S.13.b

imprisonment for a term exceeding the general limit in a magistrates’ court,
on summary conviction for an offence triable either way, or

1.204S.13.c

imprisonment for a term exceeding 2 years, on conviction on indictment.

1.204S.14

In subsection  (13) (a) , “ the maximum term for summary offences ” means—

1.204S.14.a

in relation to an offence committed before the time when section 281(5) of the
Criminal Justice Act 2003 comes into force, 6 months;

1.204S.14.b

in relation to an offence committed after that time, 51 weeks.

1.204S.15

In this Part a reference to administrative expenses in connection with IL
includes a reference to enforcement expenses.

########## Compensation

1.204T

1.204T.1

IL regulations may require a charging authority or other public authority to
pay compensation in respect of loss or damage suffered as a result of
enforcement action.

1.204T.2

In this section, “enforcement action”  means action taken under regulations
under section  204S , including—

1.204T.2.a

the suspension or cancellation of a decision relating to planning permission,

1.204T.2.b

the prohibition of development pending assumption of liability for IL or
pending payment of IL, and

1.204T.2.c

the prohibition or restriction of the use or occupation of all or part of the
site of, or anything created in the course of, a development pending payment
of IL.

1.204T.3

The regulations must not require payment of compensation—

1.204T.3.a

to a person who has failed to satisfy a liability to pay IL, or

1.204T.3.b

in other circumstances specified by the regulations.

1.204T.4

Regulations under this section may make provision about—

1.204T.4.a

the time and manner in which a claim for compensation is to be made, and

1.204T.4.b

the sums, or the method of determining the sums, payable by way of
compensation.

1.204T.5

IL regulations may permit or require a charging authority to apply IL (either
generally or subject to limits set by or determined in accordance with the
regulations) for expenditure incurred under this section.

1.204T.6

A dispute about compensation may be referred to and determined by the Upper
Tribunal.

1.204T.7

In relation to the determination of any such question, the provisions of
section 4 of the Land Compensation Act 1961 apply subject to any necessary
modifications and to the provisions of IL regulations.

########## Procedure

1.204U

1.204U.1

IL regulations may include provision about procedures to be followed in
connection with IL.

1.204U.2

In particular, the regulations may make provision about—

1.204U.2.a

procedures to be followed by a charging authority in relation to charging IL;

1.204U.2.b

consultation;

1.204U.2.c

valuation, including provision about—

1.204U.2.c.i

what factors may, must or may not be taken into account in a valuation;

1.204U.2.c.ii

who may carry out a valuation;

1.204U.2.c.iii

the procedure for a valuation;

1.204U.2.c.iv

any documentation that must be prepared in connection with a valuation;

1.204U.2.c.v

the payment of fees in relation to a valuation;

1.204U.2.c.vi

the consequences of failing to carry out a valuation, or to prepare any
documentation in connection with a valuation, in accordance with the
regulations;

1.204U.2.d

the resolution of disputes;

1.204U.2.e

the time by or at which anything may or must be done;

1.204U.2.f

reports (including the publication or other treatment of reports);

1.204U.2.g

methods of publication of documents;

1.204U.2.h

making documents available for inspection;

1.204U.2.i

providing copies of documents (with or without charge);

1.204U.2.j

the form and content of documents;

1.204U.2.k

giving notice;

1.204U.2.l

serving notices or other documents;

1.204U.2.m

examinations to be held in public in the course of setting or revising rates
or other criteria or of preparing lists;

1.204U.2.n

the terms and conditions of appointment of independent persons;

1.204U.2.o

remuneration and expenses of independent persons (which may be required to be
paid by the Secretary of State or by a charging authority);

1.204U.2.p

other costs in connection with examinations;

1.204U.2.q

reimbursement of expenditure incurred by the Secretary of State (including
provision for enforcement);

1.204U.2.r

apportionment of costs;

1.204U.2.s

combining procedures in connection with IL with procedures for another purpose
of a charging authority (including a purpose of that authority in another
capacity);

1.204U.2.t

procedures to be followed in connection with actual or potential liability for
IL.

1.204U.3

IL regulations may make provision about the procedure to be followed in
respect of an exemption from IL or a reduction of IL; in particular, the
regulations may include provision—

1.204U.3.a

about the procedure for determining whether any conditions are satisfied;

1.204U.3.b

requiring a charging authority or other person to notify specified persons of
any exemption or reduction;

1.204U.3.c

requiring a charging authority or other person to keep a record of any
exemption or reduction;

1.204U.3.d

about what provision may or must be made by a charging authority in its
charging schedule or elsewhere in connection with exemptions or reductions.

1.204U.4

A provision of this Part conferring express power to make procedural provision
in a specified context includes, in particular, power to make provision about
the matters specified in subsection (2).

1.204U.5

A power in this Part to make provision about publishing something includes a
power to make provision about making it available for inspection.

1.204U.6

Sections 229 to 231 do not apply to this Part (but IL regulations may make
similar provision).

########## Appeals

1.204V

1.204V.1

IL regulations may make provision about appeals in connection with IL.

1.204V.2

Regulations under this section may, in particular, make provision about—

1.204V.2.a

who may make an appeal,

1.204V.2.b

the grounds upon which an appeal may be made,

1.204V.2.c

the court, tribunal or other person who is to determine an appeal,

1.204V.2.d

the period within which a right of appeal may be exercised,

1.204V.2.e

the procedure on an appeal, and

1.204V.2.f

the payment of fees, and award of costs, in relation to an appeal.

1.204V.3

IL regulations must provide for a right of appeal on a question of fact in
relation to the application of methods for calculating IL (including any
questions in relation to valuation).

1.204V.4

In any proceedings for judicial review of a decision on an appeal, the
defendant is to be such person as is specified in the regulations (and the
regulations may also specify a person who is not to be the defendant for these
purposes).

########## Secretary of State: guidance

1.204W

The Secretary of State may give guidance to a charging authority or other
public authority (including an examiner appointed under this Part) about any
matter connected with IL; and the authority must have regard to the guidance.

########## Secretary of State: power to permit alteration of IL rates and thresholds

1.204X

1.204X.1

Subsections  (2)  to  (4)  apply in relation to a charging authority—

1.204X.1.a

if the Secretary of State considers that—

1.204X.1.a.i

the economic viability of development, or development of a particular
description, in the charging authority’s area is significantly impaired, or

1.204X.1.a.ii

there is a substantial risk that it will become significantly impaired,

as a result of the IL which is or will be chargeable in respect of development
in that area, or

1.204X.1.b

in any other circumstances that IL regulations may specify.

1.204X.2

The Secretary of State may publish a notice which permits the charging
authority, during a period specified in the notice, to—

1.204X.2.a

amend its charging schedule so as to reduce rates of IL, or increase any
threshold below which IL is charged at a nil or a reduced rate—

1.204X.2.a.i

in accordance with the provisions of the notice, and

1.204X.2.a.ii

for no longer than a period specified in the notice;

1.204X.2.b

amend its charging schedule so as to cancel, or delay for no longer than a
period specified in the notice—

1.204X.2.b.i

any increase in rates of IL, or

1.204X.2.b.ii

any decrease in a threshold below which IL is charged at a nil or a reduced
rate,

which is to take place under the authority’s charging schedule;

1.204X.2.c

cancel, or delay for no longer than a period specified in the notice, the
issue of the authority’s charging schedule, or any revision or replacement of
the authority’s charging schedule, which—

1.204X.2.c.i

has been approved under section 204K,

1.204X.2.c.ii

would result in an increase in rates of IL or a decrease in a threshold below
which IL is charged at a nil or a reduced rate, but

1.204X.2.c.iii

has not yet taken effect.

1.204X.3

The Secretary of State may include provision in a notice under subsection
(2)(a)(i) which confers a discretionary power on the charging authority—

1.204X.3.a

with regards to how it can amend its charging schedule for the purposes of
subsection (2)(a), or

1.204X.3.b

to allow for the amount of any liability to IL in respect of a development,
which was first permitted by planning permission prior to the publication of
the notice, to be recalculated by reference to the charging schedule as
amended in accordance with the provisions of the notice (notwithstanding
section  204D (6) ).

1.204X.4

Section  204G (13)  does not apply in relation to an amendment of a charging
schedule under subsection (2).

1.204X.5

IL regulations may specify—

1.204X.5.a

criteria which must be met, or

1.204X.5.b

procedures which must be followed,

in order for a charging authority to amend its charging schedule under
subsection  (2) .

1.204X.6

IL regulations may restrict the exercise of the power in subsection  (2) ,
including by specifying the extent to which rates may be reduced, or
thresholds may be increased, under subsection  (2) (a).

1.204X.7

IL regulations may make consequential, transitional, transitory or saving
provision in connection with, or in anticipation of, permission being given
under subsection  (2) .

########## Secretary of State: power to require review of charging schedules

1.204Y

1.204Y.1

The Secretary of State may direct a charging authority to review its charging
schedule—

1.204Y.1.a

if the Secretary of State considers that—

1.204Y.1.a.i

the economic viability of development, or development of a particular
description, in the charging authority’s area is significantly impaired, or

1.204Y.1.a.ii

there is a substantial risk that it will become significantly impaired,

as a result of the IL which is or will be chargeable in respect of development
in that area,

1.204Y.1.b

if the Secretary of State considers that a significant period of time has
elapsed since the later of the time that—

1.204Y.1.b.i

the schedule was issued,

1.204Y.1.b.ii

the schedule was last reviewed,

1.204Y.1.b.iii

the schedule was last revised, and

1.204Y.1.b.iv

the schedule was last replaced, or

1.204Y.1.c

in any other circumstances that IL regulations may specify.

1.204Y.2

If a charging authority is directed to review its charging schedule under
subsection  (1) , it must—

1.204Y.2.a

consider whether to revise or replace the charging schedule under section
204G (12) , and

1.204Y.2.b

notify the Secretary of State of its decision with reasons.

1.204Y.3

If the charging authority decides to revise or replace the charging schedule,
it must do so within a reasonable time.

1.204Y.4

If a charging authority has not complied with a direction given under
subsection  (1)  within a reasonable time and to a standard which the
Secretary of State considers adequate, the Secretary of State may appoint a
person to do so on behalf of the charging authority.

1.204Y.5

If a person appointed under subsection  (4)  decides that the charging
schedule should be revised or replaced, the charging authority must revise or
replace the schedule accordingly within a reasonable time.

1.204Y.6

If the charging authority fails to revise or replace the charging schedule in
accordance with subsection  (3)  or  (5) , the Secretary of State may appoint
a person to do so on behalf of the charging authority.

1.204Y.7

IL regulations may make provision about—

1.204Y.7.a

procedures for appointing a person under subsection  (4)  or  (6) ,

1.204Y.7.b

conditions which must be met before such an appointment may be made,

1.204Y.7.c

procedures which must be followed by the person in complying with a direction
given under subsection  (1)  or revising or replacing the charging schedule
under subsection  (6) ,

1.204Y.7.d

circumstances in which the person may be replaced,

1.204Y.7.e

duties of a charging authority where a person is appointed to act on its
behalf under subsection  (4)  or  (6) ,

1.204Y.7.f

liability for costs incurred as a result of the appointment of the person, and

1.204Y.7.g

what constitutes a reasonable time under subsections  (3)  to  (5) .

########## Parliamentary scrutiny: affordable housing

1.204Z

1.204Z.1

The Secretary of State must prepare a report which—

1.204Z.1.a

provides information, in relation to each charging authority which charges IL
in respect of development in its area, about the amount of affordable housing
provision that has been funded by IL charged by that authority,

1.204Z.1.b

assesses whether the charging of IL has resulted in more or less affordable
housing being available in areas in respect of which IL is charged than would
otherwise be the case, and

1.204Z.1.c

sets out such other information as the Secretary of State considers
appropriate in connection with the effect of IL on the provision, improvement,
replacement, operation or maintenance of affordable housing or other
infrastructure.

1.204Z.2

The Secretary of State must lay the report before each House of Parliament
before the end of the period of 5 years beginning with the date on which the
first charging schedule takes effect under this Part.

1.204Z.3

The Secretary of State must publish the report as soon as is reasonably
practicable after it has been laid before each House of Parliament.

########## Regulations: general

1.204Z1

1.204Z1.1

IL regulations—

1.204Z1.1.a

may make provision that applies generally or only to specified cases,
circumstances or areas,

1.204Z1.1.b

may make different provision for different cases, circumstances or areas,

1.204Z1.1.c

may disapply any provision made by or under this Part in relation to an area,
or a charging authority, specified or described in the regulations,

1.204Z1.1.d

may make provision requiring the provision of information in connection with
IL,

1.204Z1.1.e

may provide, or allow a charging schedule to provide, for exceptions,

1.204Z1.1.f

may confer, or allow a charging schedule to confer, a discretionary power on
the Secretary of State, a local authority or another specified person,

1.204Z1.1.g

may make provision treating CIL as if it were IL,

1.204Z1.1.h

may apply an enactment, with or without modifications, and

1.204Z1.1.i

may include provision of a kind permitted by section 232(3)(b) (and
incidental, supplemental or consequential provision may include provision
disapplying, modifying the effect of or amending an enactment).

1.204Z1.2

IL regulations are to be made by statutory instrument.

1.204Z1.3

A statutory instrument containing IL regulations may not be made unless a
draft has been laid before and approved by a resolution of the House of
Commons

########## Relationship with other powers

1.204Z2

1.204Z2.1

IL regulations may include provision about how the following powers are to be
used, or are not to be used—

1.204Z2.1.a

Part 11 (Community Infrastructure Levy) (including any power conferred by CIL
regulations under that Part),

1.204Z2.1.b

section 70 of TCPA 1990 (planning permission),

1.204Z2.1.c

section 106 of TCPA 1990 (planning obligations) (including provision about
obtaining sums under subsection (1)(d) of that section for use in connection
with IL), and

1.204Z2.1.d

section 278 of the Highways Act 1980 (execution of works).

1.204Z2.2

IL regulations may include provision about the exercise of any other power
relating to planning or development.

1.204Z2.3

IL regulations may, in particular, provide that—

1.204Z2.3.a

a specified matter may not, or may only, constitute a reason for granting
planning permission for development in specified circumstances;

1.204Z2.3.b

planning permission for development may not, or may only, be granted subject
to a condition which is of a specified description.

1.204Z2.4

The Secretary of State may give guidance to a charging or other authority
about how a power relating to planning or development is to be exercised; and
authorities must have regard to the guidance.

1.204Z2.5

Provision may be made under subsection  (1)  to  (3) , and guidance may be
given under subsection  (4) , only if the Secretary of State thinks it
necessary or expedient—

1.204Z2.5.a

in consequence of, or to supplement, provision made under section  204Z1 (1)
(c) ,

1.204Z2.5.b

for delivering the overall purpose of IL mentioned in section  204A (2) ,

1.204Z2.5.c

for enhancing the effectiveness, or increasing the use, of IL regulations,

1.204Z2.5.d

for preventing agreements, undertakings or other transactions from being used
to undermine or circumvent IL regulations,

1.204Z2.5.e

for preventing agreements, undertakings or other transactions from being used
to achieve a purpose that the Secretary of State thinks would better be
achieved through the application of IL regulations, or

1.204Z2.5.f

for preventing or restricting the imposition of burdens, the making of
agreements or the giving of undertakings, in addition to IL.

1.204Z2.6

IL regulations may provide that a power to give guidance or directions may not
be exercised—

1.204Z2.6.a

in relation to matters specified in the regulations,

1.204Z2.6.b

in cases or circumstances specified in the regulations,

1.204Z2.6.c

for a purpose specified in the regulations, or

1.204Z2.6.d

to an extent specified in the regulations.

Regulations under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6: restrictions on devolved
authorities

Sections  90  and  158

##### No power to make provision outside devolved competence

1

1.1

No provision may be made by a devolved authority acting alone in regulations
under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6 unless the provision is within the
devolved competence of the devolved authority.

1.2

See paragraphs 5 to 7 for the meaning of “devolved competence”.

##### Requirement for consent where it would otherwise be required

2

2.1

The consent of a Minister of the Crown is required before any provision is
made by the Welsh Ministers acting alone in regulations under Chapter 1 of
Part 3 or Part 6 so far as that provision, if contained in an Act of Senedd
Cymru, would require the consent of a Minister of the Crown.

2.2

The consent of the Secretary of State is required before any provision is made
by a Northern Ireland department acting alone in regulations under Chapter 1
of Part 3 or Part 6 so far as that provision would, if contained in a Bill for
an Act of the Northern Ireland Assembly, result in the Bill requiring the
consent of the Secretary of State.

2.3

Sub-paragraph (1) or (2) does not apply if—

2.3.a

the provision could be contained in subordinate legislation made otherwise
than under this Act by the Welsh Ministers acting alone or (as the case may
be) a Northern Ireland devolved authority acting alone, and

2.3.b

no such consent would be required in that case.

2.4

The consent of a Minister of the Crown is required before any provision is
made by a devolved authority acting alone in regulations under Chapter 1 of
Part 3 or Part 6 so far as that provision, if contained in—

2.4.a

subordinate legislation made otherwise than under this Act by the devolved
authority, or

2.4.b

subordinate legislation not falling within paragraph (a) and made otherwise
than under this Act by a Northern Ireland devolved authority acting alone,

would require the consent of a Minister of the Crown.

2.5

Sub-paragraph (4) does not apply if—

2.5.a

the provision could be contained in—

2.5.a.i

an Act of the Scottish Parliament, an Act of Senedd Cymru or (as the case may
be) an Act of the Northern Ireland Assembly, or

2.5.a.ii

different subordinate legislation of the kind mentioned in sub-paragraph
(4)(a) or (b) and of a devolved authority acting alone or (as the case may be)
other person acting alone, and

2.5.b

no such consent would be required in that case.

##### Requirement for joint exercise where it would otherwise be required

3

3.1

No regulations may be made under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6 by the Scottish
Ministers, so far as they contain provision which relates to a matter in
respect of which a power to make subordinate legislation otherwise than under
this Act is exercisable by the Scottish Ministers acting jointly with a
Minister of the Crown, unless the regulations are, to that extent, made
jointly with the Secretary of State.

3.2

No regulations may be made under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6 by the Welsh
Ministers, so far as they contain provision which relates to a matter in
respect of which a power to make subordinate legislation otherwise than under
this Act is exercisable by the Welsh Ministers acting jointly with a Minister
of the Crown, unless the regulations are, to that extent, made jointly with
the Secretary of State.

3.3

No regulations may be made under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6 by a Northern
Ireland department, so far as they contain provision which relates to a matter
in respect of which a power to make subordinate legislation otherwise than
under this Act is exercisable by—

3.3.a

a Northern Ireland department acting jointly with a Minister of the Crown, or

3.3.b

another Northern Ireland devolved authority acting jointly with a Minister of
the Crown,

unless the regulations are, to that extent, made jointly with the Secretary of
State.

3.4

Sub-paragraph (1), (2) or (3) does not apply if the provision could be
contained in—

3.4.a

an Act of the Scottish Parliament, an Act of Senedd Cymru or (as the case may
be) an Act of the Northern Ireland Assembly without the need for the consent
of a Minister of the Crown, or

3.4.b

different subordinate legislation made otherwise than under this Act by—

3.4.b.i

the Scottish Ministers acting alone,

3.4.b.ii

the Welsh Ministers acting alone, or

3.4.b.iii

(as the case may be), a Northern Ireland devolved authority acting alone.

##### Requirement for consultation where it would otherwise be required

4

4.1

No regulations may be made under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6 by the Welsh
Ministers acting alone, so far as they contain provision which, if contained
in an Act of Senedd Cymru, would require consultation with a Minister of the
Crown, unless the regulations are, to that extent, made after consulting with
the Minister of the Crown.

4.2

No regulations may be made under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6 by the Scottish
Ministers acting alone, so far as they contain provision which relates to a
matter in respect of which a power to make subordinate legislation otherwise
than under this Act is exercisable by the Scottish Ministers after consulting
with a Minister of the Crown, unless the regulations are, to that extent, made
after consulting with the Minister of the Crown.

4.3

No regulations may be made under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6 by the Welsh
Ministers acting alone, so far as they contain provision which relates to a
matter in respect of which a power to make subordinate legislation otherwise
than under this Act is exercisable by the Welsh Ministers after consulting
with a Minister of the Crown, unless the regulations are, to that extent, made
after consulting with the Minister of the Crown.

4.4

No regulations may be made under Chapter 1 of Part 3 or Part 6 by a Northern
Ireland department acting alone, so far as they contain provision which
relates to a matter in respect of which a power to make subordinate
legislation otherwise than under this Act is exercisable by a Northern Ireland
department after consulting with a Minister of the Crown, unless the
regulations are, to that extent, made after consulting with the Minister of
the Crown.

4.5

Sub-paragraph (2), (3) or (4) does not apply if—

4.5.a

the provision could be contained in an Act of the Scottish Parliament, an Act
of Senedd Cymru or (as the case may be) an Act of the Northern Ireland
Assembly, and

4.5.b

there would be no requirement for the consent of a Minister of the Crown, or
for consultation with a Minister of the Crown, in that case.

4.6

Sub-paragraph (2), (3) or (4) does not apply if—

4.6.a

the provision could be contained in different subordinate legislation made
otherwise than under this Act by—

4.6.a.i

the Scottish Ministers acting alone,

4.6.a.ii

the Welsh Ministers acting alone, or

4.6.a.iii

(as the case may be), a Northern Ireland devolved authority acting alone, and

4.6.b

there would be no requirement for the consent of a Minister of the Crown, or
for consultation with a Minister of the Crown, in that case.

##### Meaning of devolved competence

5

A provision is within the devolved competence of the Scottish Ministers if—

5.a

it would be within the legislative competence of the Scottish Parliament if it
were contained in an Act of that Parliament, or

5.b

it is provision which could be made in other subordinate legislation by the
Scottish Ministers.

6

A provision is within the devolved competence of the Welsh Ministers if—

6.a

it would be within the legislative competence of Senedd Cymru if it were
contained in an Act of the Senedd (including any provision that could be made
only with the consent of a Minister of the Crown), or

6.b

it is provision which could be made in other subordinate legislation by the
Welsh Ministers.

7

A provision is within the devolved competence of a Northern Ireland department
if—

7.a

the provision—

7.a.i

would be within the legislative competence of the Northern Ireland Assembly,
if contained in an Act of that Assembly, and

7.a.ii

would not, if contained in a Bill for an Act of the Northern Ireland Assembly,
result in the Bill requiring the consent of the Secretary of State,

7.b

the provision—

7.b.i

amends or repeals Northern Ireland legislation, and

7.b.ii

would be within the legislative competence of the Northern Ireland Assembly,
if contained in an Act of that Assembly, and would, if contained in a Bill for
an Act of the Northern Ireland Assembly, result in the Bill requiring the
consent of the Secretary of State, or

7.c

the provision is provision which could be made in other subordinate
legislation by any Northern Ireland devolved authority.

##### Interpretation

8

In this Schedule—

“ Minister of the Crown ” has the same meaning as in the Ministers of the
Crown Act 1975; “ Northern Ireland devolved authority ” means the First
Minister and deputy First Minister in Northern Ireland acting jointly, a
Northern Ireland Minister or a Northern Ireland department; “ subordinate
legislation ” has the meaning given in section 20(1) of the European Union
(Withdrawal) Act 2018.

  Amendments of the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017:

##### Planning

2

3

3.5

See regulation  85A  for the assumptions about nutrient pollution standards to

4

In regulation 71 (planning permission: duty to review), after paragraph (9)
insert—

4.10

See regulation  85A  for the assumptions about nutrient pollution standards to
